result.execSummary:
All charges against Passion Marie Galvin in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Passion Marie Galvin is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Passion Marie Galvin

defendant.name: Galvin, Passion Marie
defendant.address: 1608 Hillside Avenue N., Apt. 1, Minneapolis, MN 55411

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Defendant Passion Marie Galvin in court, in custody. Includes 21CM230, 22CF415-INIT, 22CF435, 22CM366, 22CM468. Atty Harrelson recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to 22CF435 Count 3: Throw/ Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor- 941.375(2) and Count 4: Throw/ Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor- 941.375(2). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses 22CF432 Counts 1 & 2, 21CM230, 22CM366, and 22CM468. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

22CF435 Count 3: W/S 2 Years Probation

- 180 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $268.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- 68 days credit against ultimate sentence

22CF435 Count 4: W/S 2 Years Probation

- 180 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $268.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- 68 days credit against ultimate sentence

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 

- DNA Sample
- Rule 25 and follow through with recommendations
- Complete psychological evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Prescribed medications only as prescribed
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- No Contact with victims with the exception of employment purposes
- Obtain GED/HSED
- Complete Moral Reconation Therapy (MRT) or an equivalent cognitive skills program
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation 

22CF415: WOE: Defendant wishes to voluntarily waive extradition. Defendant executes Waiver and court certifies same. S/T from defendant. 


Adjourned at 10:36 AM

3:18 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Passion Marie Galvin in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Court adopts Branch 2 findings regarding identification. Atty Harrelson argues motion to dismiss, as probable cause section of Amended Complaint references Eugenia Galvin, not Passion Galvin. Atty Ellenwood responds. Court questions Atty Harrelson. Court grants motion to dismiss and dismisses case without prejudice. Court resets FPT in 22CF401. Adjourned at 3:39 PM.  gll
Defendant's Supplemental Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Harrelson. km

Defendant Passion Marie Galvin in court, in custody. INCLUDES 22CF401, 21CM230, 22CF415 (EVID), 22CF435, 22CM345 and 22CM366. 22CF415: S/T - Yvonne Johnson, St. Croix County Deputy. Direct by ADA Ellenwood. Cross by Atty. Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Ellenwood. PL's Exhibit 1 - O/R. Recross by Atty. Harrelson. Counsel arguments. Court finds that identity of individual in courtroom today is Passion Marie Galvin.

Status conference on July 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

8:40 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Passion Marie Galvin in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Includes 21CM230, 22CF415 Extradition, 22CM366, 22CM345 (BR 1), and 22CF401 (BR 1). Atty Harrelson addresses identity issue of Defendant. ADA Ellenwood states DE has been identified as Passion Marie Galvin by fingerprints. Court states It will have to have an evidentiary hearing regarding identification regardless of whether there is a motion before the Court or not. Atty Harrelson anticipates discovery will resolve issue. Court sets Evidentiary Hearing on identification issue in 22CF415 and remaining cases as STC.  gll
Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Atty Harrelson.   gll   to kp 6/27

10:18 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:   Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Eugenia Marie Galvin appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF401 (ARGN) and 22CM345 (PTC). Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading.  NG. Cout notes previously scheduled hearings. Atty. Harrelson makes objection regarding identity of DE, requests dismissal. ADA Smestad responds. Adjourned: 10:23 AM. kma

10:58 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Passion Marie Galvin appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF401 (PH) and 22CM345 (PTC). S/T - Charles Welbourn, Hudson Patrol Officer. Direct by ADA Smestad. Cross by Atty. Harrelson. Redirect by ADA Smestad. Counsel arguments. Atty. Harrelson requests dismissal based on DE's improper identity. Atty. Smestad makes argument. Court finds DE's proper identity is unambiguous. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Adjourned: 11:34 AM. kma  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Arraignment on June 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Harrelson. km

Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

INCLUDES 22CF401 and 22CM345

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Target in Hudson, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:22 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad and Intern Connor Smith, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF: Eugenia Marie Galvin appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF401 and 22CM345. DE qualifies for public defender. 22CF401: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. Speedy preliminary hearing requested. 22CM345: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. Court orders bond in both cases. Court sets PH on 22CF401, SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:37 PM. kma  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
